segments.text: I'm observing a kitchen scene; it's quite active in its own way.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The daylight streams in through the window above the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: A woman stands there, diligently drying a plate with a towel.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus is entirely on that single piece of crockery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I can't help but notice the sink behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is running, and it's overflowing right onto the counter!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's pouring down the cabinet doors and onto the floor in a steady stream.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She must be standing right in the puddle, yet she shows absolutely no reaction.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not feel the water around her feet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is going to cause serious water damage to the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone could easily slip on that expanding puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a bizarre scene, really, such calm next to such chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The outside garden, visible through the window, looks so peaceful in contrast.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe she's so utterly absorbed in that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The waste of water is just incredible.
segments.speaker: PAR
